definition: shanshui poetry, genre of Classical Chinese poetry
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs

sentences.english: Zhengzhen made a lot of unique changes in the art manifestation of his poem.
sentences.chinese: 鄭珍山水詩在藝術表現上頗多獨創之處。

sentences.english: This is the value and standing of Jiang yan's poems in the history of poems.
sentences.chinese: 江淹山水詩在詩歌發展史上的地位和價值於此可見。

sentences.english: Chinese ancient landscape poetry came into being in the Jin Dynasty. It is the crystallization of poets natural aesthetic.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代山水詩形成於晉代，是詩人自然審美的結晶。

sentences.english: Xie Lingyun and Xie Yao are the outstanding poets of landscape in the history of Chinese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 謝靈運和謝胱是中國詩歌史上的山水詩大家。

sentences.english: Apart from the landscape style poems, Wang Wei is also remarkable in the composition of frontier fortress poems.
sentences.chinese: 王維除山水詩外，邊塞詩也寫得很出色。

sentences.english: As we know, Shan-shui poems were the great achievements of the literary writings of Ling-yun Hsieh.
sentences.chinese: 山水詩可說是謝靈運文學上最重要的成就。

sentences.english: And the human spirit in Lu Yous poetry of landscape has attracted even less attention.
sentences.chinese: 其山水詩中的人文主義精神，更不爲人們重視。

sentences.english: Thus Chinese landscape poetry can be used as script decipher of Chinese private garden which is the spiritual home of ancient Chinese scholars.
sentences.chinese: 山水詩是私家園林這一古代文人精神家園的文字解碼。

sentences.english: In ancient Chinese landscape poetry, return was a recurrent theme.
sentences.chinese: 在古代山水詩的創作中，迴歸是一個一以貫之的主題。

sentences.english: Taoist landscape poetry of Tang Dynasty looked upon real or imaginary scenery as aesthetic objects… Taoist poets reposed their beliefs in the nature.
sentences.chinese: 唐代道教山水詩，以真實或想像的山水爲審美對象。

definition: variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
to comment/a point by point commentary
a Yuan dynasty form of musical comedy
to pass on the light of Buddha
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
